p: Intestinal infection and the presence of 2019-nCoV in feces have been reported, but there is not enough evidence for fecal-oral transmission of 2019-nCoV. Song et al. examined the presence of 2019-nCoV in testicular biopsy and semen of COVID-19 patients and did not find positive RT-PCR [ 59]. They stated that 2019-nCov does not infect the testes and the virus may not be sexually transmitted by infected men. Some studies have shown the presence of asymptomatic viral carriers with normal laboratory and chest CT findings [ 60, 61]. The mechanism by which asymptomatic carriers can obtain and transmit 2019-nCoV requires further study. Thus, an effective intervention is needed to prevent and control the spread of 2019-nCoV.
